reviewText:
IntroductionGlacier 3: The Meltdown is a third person, combat racing game whose developers may have had big dreams for the game, but resulted in an overwhelmingly poor production. Released in 2010 on Steam, when games such as F1 2010, Blur, and heck even Need for Speed: World were their competitors (among others), this is not even a possible contestant among those other titles. Let us dive straight into it shall we?

VisualsI normally leave this section for last, but I think it's a pretty significant part of this review so here it is.
Images were pretty low resolution, car models were quite bad, even if this wasn't supposed to be a racing simulator like other titles. Animations were just barely acceptable and each level had at least a few different roads to drive on which didn't make a race completely linear. But honestly, after seeing the loading screen 3 times, I couldn't deal with it any more. It was visually cancer.

Interface
It is worth noting that this game has an options menu, but only has TWO settings in the ENTIRE menu. FX Volume and Music Volume (or something like that). This is absolutely unnaceptable considering resolution, controls, graphic quality settings, you name it! I plugged in my xbox one controller, and it would not detect it, nor did it give me the option to even change the controls. Even if a workaround exists, the fact that it lacks the basic courtesy to give me the choice in-game, feels pretty lazy to be honest.

GameplayOh boy...you see, I'm sort of a racing game fan, a huge one. I love games that give me a certain thrill, a sense of speed, a decent bit of competition at the very least. I especially love simulators, ones that give me a huge sense of immersion so I can enjoy the game even more. This game...has none of that. It has the absolute worst handling of vehicles I've ever had the misfortune of playing, I mean can you imagine a car sliding across the ground going at 1 or 2 MPH? These cars will break every law of physics you can imagine. The view is fixed to 3rd person. No decent controller support means you'll probably be using a keyboard (an absolute no no for racing fans) and no multiplayer? What exactly would motivate someone to playing this then?

Let's see......well......hmmmm.....

AudioCar sounds are quite bad, painfully so, and the rock music in the background half the time just grates on my nerves.

Summary and ConclusionSo let's see,
Broken driving physics
Horrible looking cars and environments
Essentially zero in-game settings
Boring/Repetitive Sounds and Music
Whatever you do, don't spend full price, half price or even quarter price on this. You're much better off playing some flash racing game or F2P racing game than this. There's just nothing worth coming back to.

1/10 - Please, save your money.

reviewText:
For a $2.50 Car Game... I wouldn't waste your money, there are soo many better games or bundles you could buy for that. I wouldn't spend more than 50cents on this rubbish. Don't get me wrong they have the base model for a really good car game... but they make no use of it and it seems rushed.

Firstly, there are hardly any positives and the ones I did find... don't really give the game justice.

Positives:
â™¦ Kind of challenging if you can get past all the glitchy driving
â™¦ The levels are designed well
â™¦ You have to play campaign to unlock challenges and single player maps (Gives you an incentive to play Campaign and do well)

Now onto the long list of negatives which ruin this car game and would deter anyone from wanting to buy or even play it.

Negatives:
â™¦ No Settings (Graphics, Controls, Help etc) Only two audio bars
â™¦ Can't unlock new vehicles or even customize the three you are given
â™¦ No Storyline just racing for the hell of it
â™¦ No Achievements or Steam Trading Cards
â™¦ Controls suck (Arrow keys to drive, comma, space-bar and left alt to shoot) Who doesn't use or have an option for WASD these days!
â™¦ Way too many weapon crates, meaning if you see another car, you can almost always shoot it allowing you to go infront
â™¦ If you crash, get hit or lose control of your vehicle for any reason, it's almost impossible to recover from it
â™¦ Far too many weapons
â™¦ Physics is dodgy as it seems ragdoll like when you turn or get hit
â™¦ No highscores for you to better level times in camapaign (Only a track score for coming 1st, 2nd, 3rd or 4th in the race)
â™¦ No Multiplayer whatsoever (Who makes a racing game and doesn't offer any sort of multiplayer is beyond me)
â™¦ If the format of the race start is cars infront and cars behind as you go to take off, you'll most likely get hit from behind by the AI cars even before you've had a chance to accelerate enough to take off
â™¦ The machine gun seemed like it wasn't doing anything

Overall, in my opinion, the game has the basis of a really fun Mario Kart, Crash Tag Team Racing etc styled game except the creators don't utilize what they have and have rushed it. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone and if you do end up getting it, I can assume you'll have no fun playing it.

Overall, I'd rate this 0.3/5!

PS: If you must buy this game, get it in a bundle or when it's on special. But, if you ask me... I would stear clear from it and possibly any game made by Team 6 Studios as almost all their games are negatively rated on Steam.

reviewText:
After reading the reviews for this game I thought I had to try this game out for myself. This game is bad, pretty bad. The story mode has no story. You have to figure out the controls by yourself, there is no way to configure the keys and the mouse does absolutely nothing at all. It can't even be used to adjust the view while you're driving. The physics is non existent and it makes you press the enter key on screens that have no real purpose except to slow you down. If this game was made in 2000 I could understand it's UI but for a 2010 game...

On the positive side, the music isn't too bad and the graphics look alright, like a gamecube era game with sharp graphics. The gameplay is like super mario kart where you race along picking up mystery boxes and try to shoot/bomb/ram the other competitors out of the way. The game also runs at 144fps and has zero lag and loading times.

It's a pity - this game could have been a great game if they had used common sense 101 in the UI and put in a physics engine. But as a game that came out in 2010, don't expect any updates coming out anytime soon. I'm glad I didn't have to pay for this game.

reviewText:
I received this game for free from IndieGala.
But I have to say that this is probably the worst racing game I've played. Even for an arcade style racer. Perhaps I would recommend it if it was free!

However, for a game that costs Â£7 it is a complete rip-off!!!

I completed all 6 Chapters of the Story Mode and Challenges in less than 2 hours!
There is nothing really unique about this game compared to any other racing game.

It is relatively enjoyably, yes. But it has very few features. You cannot change the resolution or graphical settings from in game. Luckily I did find an option to modify these settings from notepad C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Glacier 3 The Meltdown and then opening the Autoexec.cfg with notepad.

And for graphics options I had to go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Glacier 3 The Meltdown\Misc VideoPreset0.cfg and modify the graphics quality to 3 for all of the settings.

The same thing I had to do for the control keyboard settings by modifying the DefaultInput0.cfg.
It is ridiculous that all these basic settings aren't included in the in game settings. There's no gamepad support either which I believe is essential for this particular game.

Not to mention there are no Steam Achievements or a Multiplayer component. I understand if there were more Single Player Chapters. The animations, sound quality and graphics are poor! This game was released in 2010 but it is worse than SEGA's best selling Out Run game of 1986! You may as well as download the DOS version of Out Run and play that with DOSBox emulator, you'll have a more enjoyable experience than this.

You'll also find better flash racing games on Miniclip.com that offer you a similar or even better gameplay and graphical experience compared to this game!

However, if you are still interested in playing an arcade racing game on PC have a look at Split/Second or Ridge Racer Unbounded they're available here on Steam. These offer a far more enjoyable gameplay experience!

reviewText:
Glacier 3 is, supposedly, a game that mixes racing with car combat: I say supposedly because the actual game is horrible whether you're driving ot trying to shoot an opponent.
The aforementioned issues paired with bad graphics and unfair AI makes this game a wreck.

PROS:

-gotta admit, the devs were brave to put their names in the credits of this thing

-the music is somewhat decent

CONS:

-graphics look as if they came straight out of an early PS2 game

-weak sounds for cars and weapons

-laughable options menu, only music and fx volume, no graphics/ resolution options, no keybinds

-no tutorial whatsoever,you'll have to blindly tap buttons until you find the right ones

-horrible driving mechanics, the car turns way too much on the spot and slides all over

-aiming weapons is very hard, since there's no target lock and they shoot far and high from you, you'll basically miss most shots even when opponents are near due to the height difference between cars and targeting reticle

-unfair AI gobbles most boosts and sprints to the finish line while you trail behind

-no story whatsoever, even in Story mode

-races are very short (about 1 minute long)

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=527754214

Considering the horrible production values, that make the game look way older than it actually is, Glacier 3 also fails in providing at least an enjoyable experience when played: the unbearable driving and shooting mechanics makes for a frustrating and pointless experience as you trail behind AI controlled cars with little hope of winning at least a race.

Story mode is a joke since there's no story, it's just 4 races one after the other and a final leaderboard where you're supposed to finish first to unlock more features: even without the aforementioned issues making said races very hard to win they'd be bad regardless, since each race is just a very short lap from point A to B in boring environments.

Sorry but I have no idea what positive reviews see in this game, especially when there's better offers in the genre (Gas Guzzlers Extreme for example): Glacier 3 is a mess and simply isn't worth the asking price, nor should be purchased even if on sale.

reviewText:
Typical racing game where instead of skill, you have rely on weapons and speed boosts to get ahead.
The idea itself is ok. Actually, that would be my favourite type of racing game, but everything that could go wrong, does.
The controls and physics, the most important things in a racing game, are just horrible. It's not about them being unrealistic, they didn't have to, nor did I wanted them to be realistic; I just wanted to actually being able to control my car.
The car just flies across the screen, spinning uncontrollably, hitting every obstacle in the way and literally flying in all directions. There's no weight in it, and also, the game isn't really punishing you for hitting walls or even mines set by the other racers, so all you have to, and can do, is just float forward at full speed, and hope for the best.
The tracks, other very important thing in racing game, are boring and unimaginative, to the point that you can't really distinguish one part of the level from another (besides one part of the caves... too bad, the rest of it is just one long corridor with nothing in it.)
Not to mention they even reusing the tracks in the campaign (to prolong it I assume,) which you have to complete, in order to unlock anything else. Normally I wouldn't mind unlocking stuff by playing the game, but when the game is that tedious, it's just bothersome.
Even if it would be for free, I wouldn't recommend playing this game.
To think that after creating this, they somehow acquired right to make FlatOut sequel... It just baffles me.

reviewText: Racing games have always been a welcome platform for frauds to trick people into thinking they're getting a game. This game" can proudly join the ranks of such trash as Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing and South Park Rally. I got it for free and still feel ripped off because it took electricity to download

I received this game for free from IndieGala.
But I have to say that this is probably the worst racing game I've played. Even for an arcade style racer. Perhaps I would recommend it if it was free!

However, for a game that costs Â£7 it is a complete rip-off!!!

I completed all 6 Chapters of the Story Mode and Challenges in less than 2 hours!
There is nothing really unique about this game compared to any other racing game.

It is relatively enjoyably, yes. But it has very few features. You cannot change the resolution or graphical settings from in game. Luckily I did find an option to modify these settings from notepad C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Glacier 3 The Meltdown and then opening the Autoexec.cfg with notepad.

And for graphics options I had to go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Glacier 3 The Meltdown\Misc VideoPreset0.cfg and modify the graphics quality to 3 for all of the settings.

The same thing I had to do for the control keyboard settings by modifying the DefaultInput0.cfg.
It is ridiculous that all these basic settings aren't included in the in game settings. There's no gamepad support either which I believe is essential for this particular game.

Not to mention there are no Steam Achievements or a Multiplayer component. I understand if there were more Single Player Chapters. The animations, sound quality and graphics are poor! This game was released in 2010 but it is worse than SEGA's best selling Out Run game of 1986! You may as well as download the DOS version of Out Run and play that with DOSBox emulator, you'll have a more enjoyable experience than this.

You'll also find better flash racing games on Miniclip.com that offer you a similar or even better gameplay and graphical experience compared to this game!

However, if you are still interested in playing an arcade racing game on PC have a look at Split/Second or Ridge Racer Unbounded they're available here on Steam. These offer a far more enjoyable gameplay experience!
